prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Hello madam. I have a horary chart that I would like to have you interpret but first I need to know what house to use to represent the person that is being asked about.

 Suzanne is the wife of a friend of mine, Stefan.  Typically, when I do a chart for Stephan, I have him represented by the 9th house as a foreign connection -  He lives in Munich, Germany.  However, I don't have any established relationship or connection with Suzanne. So I'm not exactly sure what house to place her in to represent her.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes: Melissa, in traditional horary practice a spouse or partner is typically indicated by the seventh house regardless of other associations. Since Stefan is marked by the ninth house for his foreign connection, his wife—being only connected through him rather than by a personal link with you—is best represented by the seventh house in your chart.
swipes: Melissa, in traditional horary practice a spouse or partner is typically indicated by the seventh house regardless of other associations. Since Stefan is marked by the ninth house for his foreign connection, his wife—being only connected through him rather than by a personal link with you—is best represented by the seventh house in your chart.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Alright then, I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: What kind of person is Suzanne, how does she approach romantic and committed partnerships, what is her nature in this regard?

Suzanne should be represented by the 4th house.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a methodical list of the chart data relevant to Suzanne’s horary reading for the question regarding her nature in romantic and committed partnerships. In this horary setup, Suzanne is represented by the 4th house. Horary principles require that we examine both the contents (if any) of the 4th house and—if the house is empty—the condition of the house’s ruler and its aspects. The following data are drawn directly from the provided chart:

1. House Placement Data
 a. 4th House:
  • Cusp is at 29° Leo
  • Since the 4th house falls between 29° Leo and 1° Libra, there are no planets occupying this house directly.
  • The house ruler for Leo is the Sun.
 b. Ruler of the 4th House (Sun):
  • Sun’s Position: 16° 12′ Aquarius, located in the 9th house

2. Planetary Positions and Key Details
 • Sun: 16° 12′ Aquarius (9th house)
 • Moon: 8° 53′ Taurus (11th house, since the 11th starts at 1° Aries and extends into Taurus as indicated by the Moon at 8° 53′ Taurus)
 • Mercury: 12° 45′ Aquarius (9th house)
 • Venus: 0° 19′ Aries (contained in the 10th house, as 10th house starts at 29° Aquarius and spans into early Aries in this configuration)
 • Mars: 19° 25′ Cancer (r) (in the 2nd house, which begins at 14° Cancer)
 • Jupiter: 11° 16′ Gemini (12th house, starting at 13° Taurus, but note that Gemini placements occur later, here Jupiter is placed in a house determined by the given cusps)
 • Saturn: 17° 50′ Pisces (in the 10th house which covers Pisces and extends to the North Node region)
 • Uranus: 23° 16′ Taurus (in the 12th house)
 • Neptune: 28° 4′ Pisces (in the 10th house)
 • Pluto: 2° 10′ Aquarius (in the 8th house which begins at 14° Capricorn)
 • North Node: 29° 39′ Pisces (r) (in the 10th house)
 • Chiron: 19° 37′ Aries (in the 11th house)

3. Major Aspects (with orbs noted for horary precision):
 • Mars square Chiron (orb: 0°)
 • Neptune conjunct North Node (orb: 1°)
 • Venus conjunct North Node (orb: 1°)
 • Mercury trine Jupiter (orb: 1°)
 • Venus sextile Pluto (orb: 2°)
 • Venus conjunct Neptune (orb: 2°)
 • Mars trine Saturn (orb: 2°)
 • Pluto sextile North Node (orb: 3°)
 • Sun sextile Chiron (orb: 3°)
 • Mars sextile Uranus (orb: 4°)
 • Neptune square Ascendant (orb: 4°)
 • Moon square Mercury (orb: 4°)
 • Sun conjunct Mercury (orb: 4°)
 • Chiron sextile Ascendant (orb: 5°)
 • Uranus sextile Neptune (orb: 5°)
 • Ascendant trine MC (orb: 5°)
 • Sun trine Jupiter (orb: 5°)
 • Saturn sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
 • Uranus square MC (orb: 6°)
 • Jupiter square Saturn (orb: 6°)
 • Venus square Ascendant (orb: 6°)
 • Moon square Pluto (orb: 6°)
 • Saturn square Ascendant (orb: 7°)
 • Sun square Uranus (orb: 7°)
 • Sun trine Ascendant (orb: 8°)

4. Chart Patterns and Additional Features
 • The chart displays a Bowl shape configuration
 • The dominant element among the inner planets is Air
 • The predominant modality for the inner planets is Fixed
 • The bottom right quadrant is empty while most planets cluster in the top left quadrant
 • Jupiter is “rising” in the sense that it carries prominence within the chart structure
 • The square aspect occurs most frequently (nine times in total)
 • The Sun appears in ten aspects overall
 • Neptune in Pisces is in its rulership

5. Considerations for the 4th House's Ruler (the Sun)
 Since Suzanne (the querent) is represented by the empty 4th house, attention shifts to the condition of the Sun.
 • The Sun’s placement and its aspects (especially its sextile to Chiron, trine to Jupiter, and conjunct Mercury) will guide our interpretation regarding her inner nature and her approach to romantic and committed partnerships.
 • As the lord of the 4th house, the Sun’s state (via its sign, its house, and its relationships) adds insight into Suzanne’s foundational identity and how she nurtures or negotiates her relationships.

This compilation of the horary chart data—including house assignments, planetary positions, aspects, patterns, and key conditions—serves as the basis for the subsequent interpretation of Suzanne’s personality and her approach to romantic and committed partnerships.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Analysis of the horary chart for Suzanne’s romantic and committed partnerships centers on the empty 4th house and its ruler, the Sun. The following points summarize the interpretation:

1. The empty 4th house indicates that Suzanne’s foundational identity and domestic focus are not overtly self-defined by inner emotional or family concerns. Instead, attention shifts to the condition of its ruler.

2. The Sun occupies 16° Aquarius in the 9th house. This placement suggests that her inner essence and approach to love are influenced by unconventional ideas, a desire for intellectual stimulation, and an inclination toward exploring broader philosophies. Her chosen path in relationships may lean toward non-traditional models or partnerships rooted in shared progressive ideals.

3. The Sun’s aspects add nuance:
 • A sextile to Chiron points to a capacity for healing and transformation within intimate encounters. She may be drawn to relationships that allow her to address old wounds—both hers and those of her partner.
 • A trine to Jupiter infuses optimism and a sense of expansion in her partnerships. This aspect indicates that relationships can be a vehicle for personal growth and adventure.
 • A square to Uranus reveals an unpredictable streak. Suzanne values her independence and may push back against constraints in relationships, with sudden shifts or unexpected developments serving as catalysts for change.

4. The Sun’s conjunction with Mercury reinforces an emphasis on communication and intellectual rapport. Suzanne is likely to approach relationships through articulate, direct dialogue, favoring partners who stimulate her mind.

5. The combination of these factors indicates that Suzanne is inclined to seek relationships that are progressive, intellectually engaging, and growth-oriented. She is not one to adhere strictly to traditional domestic roles; instead, she pursues partnerships that allow her freedom and encourage exploration of new ideas and perspectives.

These observations provide the foundation for understanding Suzanne’s nature in romantic and committed partnerships.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: I'm not exactly sure that I understand. Can you break this down a little more clearly for me with better detail?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Adjusting my shawl and peering intently at the chart before me

My dear, let me break this down more clearly. When examining Suzanne's nature in relationships, several key factors emerge:

1. Core Identity (4th House & Sun)
- The 4th house being empty tells us Suzanne doesn't define herself through traditional domestic roles
- Her ruling Sun in Aquarius shows she's inherently:
  • Independent-minded
  • Intellectually driven
  • Potentially rebellious against convention
  • Seeks unique experiences

2. Relationship Style (Venus Aspects)
- Venus at 0° Aries in the 10th house reveals:
  • She's direct and passionate in pursuit
  • Takes charge in relationships
  • May be somewhat impulsive in love
  • Needs excitement and challenge

3. Emotional Nature (Moon Position)
- Moon in Taurus in the 11th house indicates:
  • Seeks security but on her own terms
  • Values friendship as foundation
  • Needs physical affection
  • Can be stubborn about personal values

4. Sexual Nature (Mars Position)
- Mars retrograde in Cancer in the 2nd house suggests:
  • Passionate but sometimes hesitant
  • Protective of intimate space
  • May struggle with direct sexual expression
  • Needs emotional security for physical intimacy

5. Partnership Dynamics (7th House)
- With Sagittarius on the cusp:
  • Seeks adventure in partnership
  • Needs philosophical alignment
  • May resist commitment that feels constraining
  • Values honesty and directness

The chart suggests Suzanne is quite complex in relationships. She's independent and unconventional (Aquarius Sun), yet seeks security (Taurus Moon). She's bold in pursuit (Aries Venus) but can be protective and cautious in intimacy (Cancer Mars).

In practical terms, she likely:
- Initiates relationships confidently
- Needs mental stimulation and unique experiences
- Values honest communication
- May struggle with vulnerability
- Requires both freedom and security
- Can be stubborn about personal values
- Needs a partner who understands her complexity

Leaning forward, my voice dropping to a knowing whisper

The cards suggest she may have experienced past relationship difficulties due to these seemingly contradictory needs. Partners may find her paradoxical - both independent and needing security, both bold and cautious.

Would you like me to elaborate on any particular aspect of her nature?

2. Relationship Style (Venus Aspects)
- Venus at 0° Aries in the 10th house reveals:
  • She's direct and passionate in pursuit
  • Takes charge in relationships
  • May be somewhat impulsive in love
  • Needs excitement and challenge

3. Emotional Nature (Moon Position)
- Moon in Taurus in the 11th house indicates:
  • Seeks security but on her own terms
  • Values friendship as foundation
  • Needs physical affection
  • Can be stubborn about personal values

4. Sexual Nature (Mars Position)
- Mars retrograde in Cancer in the 2nd house suggests:
  • Passionate but sometimes hesitant
  • Protective of intimate space
  • May struggle with direct sexual expression
  • Needs emotional security for physical intimacy

5. Partnership Dynamics (7th House)
- With Sagittarius on the cusp:
  • Seeks adventure in partnership
  • Needs philosophical alignment
  • May resist commitment that feels constraining
  • Values honesty and directness

The chart suggests Suzanne is quite complex in relationships. She's independent and unconventional (Aquarius Sun), yet seeks security (Taurus Moon). She's bold in pursuit (Aries Venus) but can be protective and cautious in intimacy (Cancer Mars).

In practical terms, she likely:
- Initiates relationships confidently
- Needs mental stimulation and unique experiences
- Values honest communication
- May struggle with vulnerability
- Requires both freedom and security
- Can be stubborn about personal values
- Needs a partner who understands her complexity

Leaning forward, my voice dropping to a knowing whisper

The cards suggest she may have experienced past relationship difficulties due to these seemingly contradictory needs. Partners may find her paradoxical - both independent and needing security, both bold and cautious.

Would you like me to elaborate on any particular aspect of her nature?

mes: Yes, I'm trying to understand what may drive her to berate her husband in public.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
adjusting my shawl and leaning forward with concern

Ah, now I see why you seek clarity. Looking more deeply at the aspects,

The Sun square Uranus (orb: 7°) combined with Mars retrograde in Cancer shows a deep-seated pattern of public outbursts stemming from:

1. Control Issues (Mars retrograde in Cancer, 2nd house)
- Feels financially or emotionally insecure
- Represses anger until it explodes
- Uses public humiliation as a power play
- Deep fear of vulnerability manifesting as aggression

2. Identity Conflicts (Sun in Aquarius, 9th house)
- Needs to appear superior/enlightened
- Uses intellectual superiority as a weapon
- Public performance of dominance
- Masks deep insecurity with dramatic displays

3. Emotional Triggers (Moon square Mercury, Moon square Pluto)
- When feeling threatened, lashes out intellectually
- Uses words as weapons when feeling powerless
- Deep-seated need to control through humiliation
- Pattern of emotional manipulation

The Mars square Chiron (orb: 0°) is particularly telling - it points to:
- Unhealed wounds around masculine energy
- Possible childhood trauma with father figure
- Projects past hurts onto current partner
- Uses public space as stage for working out private pain

lowering my voice

The Venus square Ascendant suggests she's fully aware of how she appears to others during these outbursts, but the Neptune square Ascendant shows she's deluding herself about the real motivations behind her behavior.

Would you like me to explore any of these aspects in more detail?
